title: Apple WebKit innerHTML element Substitution Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple WebKit. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page.
The specific flaw exists in the WebCore's HTMLObjectElement::renderFallBackContent() method. By rewriting an HTML element via the document's innerHTML() method a memory corruption occurs resulting from a call-after-free. This can be leveraged to execute arbitrary code under the context of the current user.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT4070
timeline:
2009-10-21 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2010-03-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
